metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12133 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the clntudp_call function in sunrpc/clnt_udp.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.26 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to error path.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> The CVE description doesn't seem to match the description in the linked bug report and upstream patch sbeattie> introduced in CVE-2016-4429 fix

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.2').
